title: House approves formal impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden
description: The 221-212 party-line vote put the entire House Republican conference on record in support of an impeachment process on Wednesday. Joe Biden swiftly denounced Republicans' move as a 'baseless political stunt.'

title: The penguin that sleeps 10,000 times a day
description: In Antarctica, an international team discovered that the chinstrap penguin sleeps in average sessions of four seconds. The bird takes around 10,000 naps a day, for a total of 11 hours of sleep.

title: French schoolgirl threatened knife attack on teacher
description: While no one was hurt in the incident, in which a 12-year-old girl brandished a kitchen knife during an English class in the northern French city of Rennes, a psychiatric examination of the child has been ordered 'to shed further light on this situation.'

title: Hunter Biden speaks out against father's impeachment inquiry
description: 'There is no fairness or decency in what these Republicans are doing,' President Biden's son Hunter stated, decrying allegations of 'influence peddling' by his father.  The US House is set to vote later on a formal impeachment inquiry based on these claims.

title: EU unlocks €10.2 billion of funding for Hungary before key summit
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban has threatened to veto measures to both support and discuss integrating Ukraine at the upcoming European summit. This has led EU lawmakers to decry this release of funds to Hungary as giving in to its 'blackmail.'

title: In Paris, pregnant women and mothers with newborns are left without emergency accommodation
description: The French government has reduced the number of places available for emergency accommodation. In and around the capital, priority shelter-seekers are ending up on the streets or remaining in overcrowded maternity wards.

title: Swiss defense minister sworn in as next president
description: As defense minister, Viola Amherd, a member of The Centre party, obtained budget increases and US-made F-35 fighters. She will hold the office for 2024, then be succeeded by Finance Minister Karin Keller-Sutter.

title: OpenAI partners with Axel Springer to include journalism in ChatGPT
description: German media company Axel Springer, whose brands include Politico, Business Insider and Bild, has signed a deal allowing ChatGPT to include its journalism, paywalled and open-access, in the responses it generates.

title: Talks open on a new intergovernmental platform on chemical pollution
description: The shape of this 'chemical IPCC' is being discussed in Nairobi from December 11-15, under UN Environment Program auspices. However, the chemical industry's involvement in this future panel has raised concerns.

title: US Supreme Court to rule on abortion pill restrictions
description: The Court agreed on Wednesday to rule on restrictions imposed by a lower court on mifepristone, a widely used abortion pill.

title: Tesla recalls over 2 million cars in the US to fix Autopilot software
description: The recall affects 2.03 million Tesla vehicles, includes Models S, X, Y and 3, and will be addressed via an 'over-the-air software remedy,' which will install additional alerts to encourage drivers to pay attention to the road.

title: Now hiring: Russian propaganda networks want French freelance journalists
description: Analysis of a network of individuals suspected of aiding Russian propaganda operations in Europe points to the involvement of operators with ties to the GRU, the Russian military intelligence service.

title: Notre-Dame de Paris to be equipped with a unique fire protection system
description: Philippe Jost, president of Rebuilding Notre-Dame de Paris, explained the 'complete rethink of its fire protection' to a parliamentary commission. The cathedral is due to re-open on December 8, 2024.

title: Ukraine's European borders are being blockaded by discontented truckers
description: Polish truckers accusing their Ukrainian counterparts of unfair competition have been blocking border crossings for over a month. Slovak and Hungarian truckers have now joined the movement.

title: After debates, the new Dutch legislature will continue to support Ukraine
description: Even though Eurosceptic parties, who partly oppose supporting Ukraine, defeated Prime Minister Mark Rutte's party at the polls, MPs have agreed to continue providing aid.

title: COP28: A disappointing outcome on the crucial issue of adaptation to climate change
description: While many parties wanted more precise commitments from rich countries to help vulnerable countries cope with the dramatic effects of global warming, this particular issue has been postponed.

title: Le Monde's top 10 destinations | #7 Pyrenean peaks
description: Where to travel in 2024? This year, Le Monde answers that question with 10 travel picks accessible by train from France. Discover two travel guides per week throughout December. Number 7: The heart of the Pyrénées.

title: Poland investigates lawmaker for dousing menorah
description: Poland's prosecutor's office said it had opened a probe into Tuesday's incident after far-right lawmaker Grzegorz Braun put out a Hanukkah menorah with a fire extinguisher.

title: EU backs rules to improve app workers' conditions
description: Member states and the European Parliament found a deal to strengthen the working conditions of delivers, ride-hailing drivers and other workers of the gig economy.

title: Niger says all French troops will have left by December 22
description: After relations between the two countries nosedived, France said it would withdraw all its troops by the end of the year. Nigerien media has reported that 80% of the French forces have already left.

title: Support for Ukraine: Weakness is not an option
description: Republican members of Congress who want to block US aid to Ukraine are only encouraging Vladimir Putin's Russia to prolong the fighting.

title: COP28: Historic agreement in Dubai calls for 'transitioning away from fossil fuels'
description: The countries participating at the global conference approved a compromise text calling for progressively abandoning fossil fuels to avoid the wost consequences of climate change, while avoiding the word 'phase-out.'

title: UK's Sunak narrowly overcomes internal rebellion over immigration
description: The British prime minister saw his plan to send asylum seekers to Rwanda approved by the House of Commons. But the Conservatives revealed deep divisions.

title: French far right calls for early elections after rejection of immigration bill
description: As often, the far-right Rassemblement National has seized the opportunity of a government crisis to call for a return to the polls. Its tactical goal is to keep pushing the narrative that its victory is inevitable.

title: French court orders return of deported Uzbek national in rebuke to interior minister
description: The country's top administrative court ordered the Interior Ministry to allow the return of an Uzbek national who had been deported on suspicions of ties to the jihadist movement. Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin had ignored a ruling from the European Court of Human Rights.

title: Donald Tusk sworn in as Poland's new prime minister
description: Tusk previously served as prime minister from 2007-2014. He has pledged to restore Poland's position in the European Union after strained ties with Brussels.

title: Over 50 people injured in nighttime Russian missile attack on Ukrainian capital
description: Twenty people including two children were hospitalized after debris from intercepted missiles fell in an eastern Kyiv district. 33 people received medical treatment on the spot.

title: UN climate draft deal calls for 'transitioning away' from fossil fuels, but no 'phase-out'
description: Although potentially historic, the COP28 draft deal shies away from stronger language favored by many countries.

title: The Palestinian Authority's conflicted security relationship with Israel in the West Bank
description: In the territory occupied by the Jewish state, Palestinian forces have to coordinate with their Israeli counterparts. These ties fuel suspicions of collaboration and undermines their legitimacy in the eyes of the population.

title: Andre Braugher, Emmy-winning actor who starred in 'Homicide' and 'Brooklyn Nine-Nine,' dies at 61
description: Braugher's publicist says the actor died after a short illness.

title: 'Wonka' delights in delicious chocolate romp
description: Paul King's film, which is a prequel based on Roald Dahl's novel "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory," relishes in its attention to detail and lightheartedness. Timothée Chalamet stars as an optimistic, energetic young Willy Wonka.

title: Argentina devalues peso, unveils measures to avoid 'hyperinflation'
description: Newly-inaugurated president Javier Milei has vowed to cut spending and put an end to all new public construction projects, among a slew of shock measures.

title: Millions of Russians ordered to hand over passports to authorities
description: The measure, which has just come into force, especially applies to men who have been summoned for "partial" military mobilization. But it also potentially concerns all citizens residing abroad.

title: Zelensky pleads his case for Ukraine aid on Capitol Hill and at the White House
description: Ukrainian president's surprise trip draws Democratic support and Republican skepticism.
